description: In my setup, there are two type of hypervisors ESX and KVM. The server is on ESX host. But during resize, it failed as it is migrated from one host (i.e. ESX host) to another (i.e. KVM host).
title: Resize server up failed when server's diskConfig option is Manual

comments.content: In my setup, there are two type of hypervisors ESX and KVM. The server is on ESX host. But during resize, it failed as it is migrated from one host (i.e. ESX host) to another (i.e. KVM host).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~liutong
https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~liutong

comments.content:
Not sure I get your problem. The error message is self-explicit : "Server disk was unable to be resized because: Resize to zero disk flavor is not allowed."

It seems the flavor you want for resizing your instance has a root_gb variable equals to 0. In that case, Nova doesn't accept to resize from an image-based instance to a volume-based one.

Setting the bug report as Invalid, but please move it back to New if you don't agree.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sylvain-bauza

comments.content:
The tempest log above is the initial failure due to "resize to zero disk flavor is not allowed". Later I tried with more disk manually, and it still failed during migration. Please see below for more information.

then i resize it to a flavor with more ram and nothing different

| 84 | m1.micro  | 128       | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      |

Server resizing... 67% complete
Error resizing server
ERROR (InstanceInErrorState): <type 'NoneType'> can't be decoded

but i do not see any errors in n-cpu.log

the last thing i see it the 67% error but the instance is in error state

2016-03-19 00:01:55.225 ^[[00;32mDEBUG nova.virt.vmwareapi.vmops [^[[01;36mreq-1c57a8b0-1447-4734-96c6-642bf761cb0c ^[[00;36mdemo demo^[[00;32m] ^[[01;35m[instance: 6a657875-fe4f-405d-9a50-d96d6cd1cd0a] ^[[00;32mUpdating instance '6a657875-fe4f-405d-9a50-d96d6cd1cd0a' progress to 67^[[00m ^[[00;33mfrom (pid=3702) _update_instance_progress /opt/stack/nova/nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py:1225^[[00m
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~liutong
https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~liutong

comments.content:
Okay, I can see that the resize is failing, probably because it tries to JSON-decode a None string.

Are you sure you can't find anything in the n-cpu logs ? You could also take a look on the n-cond logs.

Anyway, I'm not a virt expert, but I don't know if it's possible to resize an instance from an ESX-backed file to a libvirt one, I guess it's probably not supported but I'll double-check.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sylvain-bauza

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor
